oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: !nanni (XI)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The song of the !ke tsa'ba which is a large black bird. It is respected and not eaten. It eats a root called the djon. 1) p.9161v: the !ke tsa'ba bird is not eaten, but is respected by the !kun; what it eats, 2) See also Song of the sho sho and Song of the ||ku and Song of the !kan ||ka ||karashe and The song of the ≠ne≠nebbi (woodpigeon) and The song of the sauko and The song of the ≠na≠n'arro and The song of the Ngogan-a (a little bird) and The song of the mother of the little buck and The song of the ||gani (a bird) and The song of the !korro-ssin !ku (or Pit-making Bushmen) and A song of the |kam-ssin !ku (or sun Bushmen) and The song of the !na !na'rishe (a bird), 3) This is found in Book XI & XII-3.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd !kun notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The song of the !ke tsa'ba (a bird)
